qas.question: The terms uppercase and lowercase originated from the common layout which type of drawers?
Besides being a single word or two separate words, how can the words uppercase and lowercase be expressed?
In relation to the shelf the small letters were located, where were the capital letters?
Which characteristic of capital letters made it easy to remember.

context: The terms upper case and lower case can be written as two consecutive words, connected with a <a1_0>hyphen<a1_0/> (upper-case and lower-case), or as a single word (uppercase and lowercase). These terms originated from the common layouts of the <a0_0>shallow<a0_0/> drawers called type cases used to hold the movable type for letterpress printing. Traditionally, the capital letters were stored in a separate case that was <a2_0>located above<a2_0/> the case that held the small letters, and the name proved easy to remember since capital letters are <a3_0>taller<a3_0/>.
